item.title: 'Bad debates happen': Allies support Biden, tell him to stay in the race
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Setback for Macron: Far Right wins first round of election in France
item.description: Following the parliamentary election's first round, France faces a pivotal moment with the National Rally party's rise. The political dynamics suggest a significant challenge to President Macron's leadership, prompting discussions of potential alliances and the need for cohesive democratic responses to navigate the evolving landscape effectively.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mother of war hero questions decision to award Prince Harry the Pat Tillman award
item.description: The announcement has sparked controversy, including displeasure voiced on air by TV host Pat McAfee and dissatisfaction expressed by the mother of the fallen soldier, who noted she was not consulted about the decision.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jill Biden's dress makes a post-debate statement
Biden's poor show at presidential debate raises alarm in Israel
Fast and furious: Russia using bikes to stir chaos in Ukraine
Iran warns of 'obliterating war' if Israel starts offensive in Lebanon
Bibi vows to fight on amid report of tweaks in truce plan
Sunak rejects poll doomsayers, says Tory win in July 4 polls still possible
Donald Trump's daughter-in-law says Kamala Harris polls as bad as Biden
item.description: "Millions of Americans came out in those primaries and voted for Joe Biden to be their nominee on the Democrat side. If they decide right here in the 11th hour to plug somebody else in, and it's not Kamala Harris, I can't think of a bigger assault to our democratic process than doing just that. But let's see what they do. Regardless if it's Joe Biden [or] Kamala Harris, Donald Trump's polls show us right now that the American people are behind him," Lara Trump told Fox News.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Far-right seen winning 34% of vote in round 1 of France polls'
item.description: Marine Le Pen's National Rally (RN) led the first round of France's parliamentary elections with about 34% of the vote. President Macron's Together alliance secured 20.5%-23%, while the New Popular Front got around 29%. The final outcome hinges on next week's run-off and political alliances in France's 577 constituencies. Voter turnout was nearly 60%. Le Pen seeks an RN majority to form a government, while Macron urges voters to prevent the far-right from taking office.

item.title: Iran election shows declining voter support amid calls for change
Biden using teleprompter won't be enough, says Scaramucci
item.description: New York Times which also called Biden to opt out of the contest noted the stark differences between the two Bidens. Joe Biden Two, with the help of a teleprompter, is enthusiastic and forceful, clear and concise on his position on abortion, immigration, taxes and race. "Joe Biden Two was clear about Mr. Trumpâ€™s threat to democracy. Joe Biden One left viewers scratching their heads about the topic that the president has long said motivated his run in 2020," NYT observed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: This historian predicted 9/10 election results correctly. On Biden, he says..
item.description: Historian Allan Lichtman is credited to have predicted 9 out of 10 election results correctly. Amid clamors for replacing Joe Biden as the Democrat's presidential candidate, he said it could cost the Democrat the 2024 election. He said it will be a huge mistake as those who are asking Biden to bow out of the contest are not doctors and they do not know whether Biden is capable of continuing another term or not. "This is foolhardy nonsense," the American University historian said on CNN.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan woman leader's video viral: 'Why don't you make eye contact'
item.description: "My party leaders have taught me to speak looking into the eyes. I can't continue speaking if you avoid eye contact like this. Wear your glasses, sir," Zartaj Gul told Speaker Ayaz Sadiq. "I am a leader. I have got 1.5 lakh votes. If you don't listen to me, I will not be able to speak to you," Zartaj Gul said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pride March, events could be targets of violence, warns NYPD
item.description: The New York Police Department's Intel Bureau warned that the weekend's Pride March and other Pride events could be targets for violence. "LGBTQIA+ community remains a high priority target for violent extremists and malicious actors across the ideological spectrum, necessitating elevated vigilance during the Pride March and the other Pride-related events across New York City," according to the NYPD.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Not the same person I married: Why Jill Biden's ex-husband is livid
item.description: Jill Biden's former husband Bill Stevenson who once called Joe Biden liar for stealing his anecdote back in the time when Jill was still married to Bill said he can't recognize today's Jill who is so adamant on pushing Joe Biden to the presidential contest. Bill said he saw Jill grew and was very proud of her but cannot support her defending a failing Joe.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
